primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a state of being under a divine curse due to the impossibility of self-justification to a state of redemption through Christ's substitutionary death.

tekstueel_bewijs: Christ redeemed us from the curse
he alone has done it for us
Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law
making us not bent, but straight
no condemnation in heaven or earth that can touch us

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied via the 'vision' of Paul) and the Word (Paul's preaching)
tekstueel_bewijs: transformed by his vision of the risen Lord
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External power that transforms the Subject's understanding.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Curse of the Law / Power of Sin
tekstueel_bewijs: we are in bondage to the power of Sin
the curse that would have been ours
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a lack of willpower but a judicial and ontological 'curse' and 'bondage' that humans cannot break.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt at self-justification through works or status.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / 'We'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is presented as a failed attempt that necessitates the primary program (Christ's intervention).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus was taking upon himself the curse
He alone can do it for us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We seek to justify ourselves by the kinds of people we think we are

voorbeelden: Cursed be every one who does not abide by all things
we can't do the right thing all the time even if we want to
Now he understood: Jesus was taking upon himself...
we can't do it for ourselves
He alone can do it for us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the lack of human 'Pouvoir' (ability) and the total 'Pouvoir' of Christ to act on the sinner's behalf.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at ~S1 (Self-justification), moves to S2 (The Curse), then shows Christ taking S2 to bring the hearer to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary atonement: Christ becomes the 'Contrary' (Curse) to release the 'Contradiction' (Sinner).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the curse is described as 'radical' and 'Godforsaken'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects human agency as a means of salvation and positions Christ as the sole active Subject of redemption.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We justify ourselves by elevating ourselves above others.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law by becoming a curse for us.
bondage to the power of Sin

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used as a witness to the gospel, not as a moral example to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God blinded and transformed Paul.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'torment' of self-justification and guilt.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; the hearer is the passive beneficiary of Christ's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfectly integrated; the failure of the human program leads directly to the necessity of the divine program.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the work of the Son; the Spirit's role is implicit in the 'knowing' and 'believing'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total inability; 'we can't do the right thing even if we want to'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is purely theocentric. Christ is the Subject, the Curse is the Opponent, and the Hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic 'Good Friday' structure.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Could slightly increase the 'Vouloir' (the desire to respond) in the conclusion.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (The Curse) is already maximized.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in non-moralistic preaching. It maintains God as the Subject of all redemptive verbs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the use of the 'friend' anecdote, semiotics shows the friend is an actant illustrating the 'Receiver's' inability to self-justify.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Semiotics highlights the 'Subject-Switch' from the Pharisee Paul to the Redeemed Paul, mirroring the shift from Law to Grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Curse' is not just a theme but a functional 'Opponent' that only a divine 'Subject' can defeat.

justify.primair_subject: Man (as failed attempt) / God (as final act)

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the printer's analogy to move the Object from a legal status to an ontological reality (making us straight).
